main event: A civilian observer in Window Rock, Arizona, reported sighting a spherical object moving at high speed with a red fire at the center and blue edges, progressing towards the north, leaving a slight trail behind. The object was about three feet in diameter and seen for 30-60 seconds. The report concludes that it was an astrological event, specifically a meteor.
interesting points: The object was described as a sphere with a red fire at the center and blue edges, leaving a slight trail as it moved at a high rate of speed.
The observer, a civilian, was a man of excellent character and was reported to have observed the object through the clear windshield of a car.
The report states that the object disintegrated progressively and had no effect on clouds.
The observer reported no sound or odor associated with the object and noted the very slight trail it left behind.
The sighting was estimated to last 30-60 seconds, and the object was seen moving at a speed of 200-300 miles per hour, with bright enough luminosity to be visible in daylight.
sighted object: a spherical object with red fire at the center and blue at the edges
witnesses: civilian observer, reported as a man of excellent character
